website_summaries.verdict: This inexpensive chair is a good value but suffers occasional quality control issues.
cons: Desk-length" is the only arm choice
Occasional complaints about product quality and durability

customer_reviews.title: Plastic wheels broken already!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this wheelchair less than three months and two of the spokes of the plastic wheels have broken. Who would make wheels on a wheelchair of plastic? Luckily, we have an old wheelchair that has metal wheels, but it is so heavy that it is problem to put into my car when I take my wife to the doctor. When I purchased it in November, I paid $89.24. Today I called the manufacture and asked about a replacement wheel. It would cost me about $97. The wheelchair is going to the dump tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E. Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: This is a well-built chair for the money.
customer_reviews.text: My wife broke her leg, and needs a wheelchair to get around for the next two months. The rented wheelchair was difficult to maneuver through a tight "dog leg" bedroom entry, and while strong, it was a struggle to lift into the SUV. I decided to chance the 18" Blue Streak wheelchair, and both my wife and I are impressed. It's lighter, narrower, and easier to maneuver. The construction is good, and the features compare with more expensive chairs. Note that my wife is less than 140 lbs, and relatively thin. For a larger, heavier passenger, I would suggest a bigger, stronger, chair.
customer_reviews.author: PM Dave

customer_reviews.title: Broke down on me
customer_reviews.text: This garbage broke on me after I had it for a month. It is held together with cheap plastic. I am 110lbs and this should NOT have broken like it did. It cant handle being ridden over pavement without permanently damaging the thing. I was at a convention and it decided that it was going to start pulling to the right. I checked it out and couldnt find a problem. Then plastic just started breaking off everywhere. It was a horrible situation. By the time I found my fiancee, my left hand was blistered and bruised and I passed out crying from all the exertion. Some plastic got stuck in the wheel. We could never find the problem!!
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a WASTE OF MONEY! Bought the wheelchair on August 8th. 2018 today is 9/25/15 and is falling apart, I would think the chair would last longer than 2 months! the back is almost off where the thread is coming out, the brakes is always lose, the seat hooks that hold to the back of the wheelchair is broken, the chair doesn't want to fold/unfold easily have to fight with it especially if it's raining to get it back into vehicle you're going to get soaked! The chair is very shakey. Stay away from this one...
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: After less than a week the footrest snapped. Wondering how I can go about getting a replacement part? Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre H.

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for the price
customer_reviews.text: This chair is really great for what I need it for. I love the fact that the footrests come off and we could actually remove the flip back arms to make the chair lighter and easier to maneuver for me. The wheels are plastic so it's not as easy to go over some surfaces and there are no anti-tip arms in the back so you have to be careful when going up steep spots. Overall though, the quality is really good for the low cost and mine arrived with a small broken piece and the company replaced it immediately without hesitation so the customer service is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Jill Justman

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product! Terrible Company!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Blue Streak Wheel Chair 7 months ago. When received, had multiple problems and had to be replaced. After 7 months the Bearings on both wheels were shot and front Castors shimmy. Drive offered to send me the bearings so that I could repack and install them myself. Told be they only guarantee the frame and welded parts beyond 60 days. Wearable part guaranteed only for 60 days. My wife had her last wheelchair for 10 years and never had to replace bearings. This is an awful product and If you purchase from this company, expect the worst!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Waldman

customer_reviews.title: Be careful  when considering this chair.
customer_reviews.text: This chair is lightweight for being a wheelchair, folds easily, but it is also wobbly. this chair broke within 24 hrs of using it. I am not sure if this particular chair was defective. I would definitely consider a different wheelchair. *I did contact Amazon and they are replacing it for free* I will update on the next one if it better or does the same. ***Update the second one broke within 1 month. I definitely do not recommend this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: Product was delivered quickly and was easy to assembly, the only requirement was to fasten the foot rests and it was quite simple. Chair maneuvers through hallways and doorways easily. The occupant in the chair is able to propel the chair with ease using the hand wheels. Nice bag in rear to accommodate most necessities. Seat is very adequate. Would definitely recommend to someone in need of reliable transport if walking isn't any option.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Piano Lady

customer_reviews.title: Low cost yet works well
customer_reviews.text: I use this wheelchair to assist my spouse about an assisted living facility. Our travel is approximately 2000 feet on level carpeted floors each day plus occasional visits to doctor appointments. This wheelchair has been in use for 3 months. I have used loner wheelchairs at various medical facilities and find that this wheelchair works just as well as any of the loners. For a brief time we both required wheelchairs and I purchased a second identical chair for myself. The second wheelchair is now in storage and acts as backup in the event the spouse's chair fails or I require it for myself.
customer_reviews.author: RDLilly

customer_reviews.title: Rolling rolling rolling!
customer_reviews.text: It is an amazing chair for the price. We needed an inexpensive chair for a long trip to Asia, and this fit the bill. It’s very sturdy, folds with one hand, rolls and turns smoothly, has those great lift-away arms for easy transfers, and can fit in the back of a standard vehicle. I read the reviews and someone suggested a little WD-40 to the slide mechanism prior to use. Had zero problems folding it. It comes with a small wrench, and I tightened all the bolts prior to travel. I work in a skilled nursing facility, and this WC is easily as good as the ones provided by our PT department, for a fraction of what they charge (shhh!)
customer_reviews.author: On The Go

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: Overall it’s a comfortable wheelchair. I had surgery on my feet and has to have the foot rest and three days after using it the feet rest would randomly not stay locked in and my feet would smack the floor so I couldn’t use them. They wouldn’t stay locked in place when you lock them in. And the wheels felt like it was rubbing on something and the breaks were not on or anything... maybe I just got a bad wheel chair idk but now I got to find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Berger

customer_reviews.title: This is a good solid wheelchair.
customer_reviews.text: My wife needed a wheelchair while recovering from a fall. This wheelchair fits the bill. It is solid and economical to buy. I had priced rental wheelchairs and this chair was less expensive to buy than the price of two weeks rental on a similar chair. Its easy to use and seems solidly built. At my age (82) it is little heavy to lift in and out of a car trunk but that's just me. Overall well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sister but Broke within 2 months of use. The wheels bowed very easily every time while trying to get up 1 curb. Not built strong at all. My sister isn't even a heavy set woman. SmH! This is only for inside the house use.
customer_reviews.author: Orneet

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the bad reviews scare you
customer_reviews.text: I read the bad reviews, and almost didn't buy this. I'm glad I did, though. I don't understand people calling it cheap trash. It is well made and works well. I have a torn ligament in my foot and this helps me get around the house and go to church. I love that you can easily collapse it by just pushing it closed. It rolls easily on carpet and hardwood,is comfortable to sit in too. Be sure to measure your doors first to get the size that will fit. I'm glad I did, because I ordered size 18 inch which fit through my doors just right. If I had bought the 20 inch it would not have fit.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Millard

customer_reviews.title: Broken parts and squeaky within hours..
customer_reviews.text: Within two minutes of opening the box, the bottom of the arms that hooks in (both of the arms) to the frame broke. So now the arms will not look into place. Now it's four hours after opening, and the left wheel is squeaking... so I have broken pieces and a squeaking wheel in less than a few hours. Needed this till I get a rigid in a few months but this makes it pretty much not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Fair price
customer_reviews.text: Recovering from 2 broken hips I needed a quality wheel chair. As the need will not exceed 12 weeks I was looking for a well reviewed product at a reasonable price. Having a chair lift I needed to get one of these upstairs and one downstairs. After a great deal of research I settled on this model. It is priced fairly and it is a quality constructed for around $100 each! I don't think you will go wrong choosing this chair.
customer_reviews.author: JADroste0215

customer_reviews.title: A quality chair at an excellent price!
customer_reviews.text: This wheelchair is identical to the one the MediLodge rented for my wife (who is recovering from back injuries), so I sent the rental back and ordered the same on here on Amazon! The model with the 18" seat has an overall width of 24" and easily fits thru our narrow 28" doorways (we have a small/old house). The chair is pretty solid all around, comes with locking brakes, and the arm rests raise up making it easy for the wife to enter and exit the bed and shower . The overall quality of the chair, for the price is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: This wheelchair gets the job done but isn't the best that I have ever used. The chair itself sits slightly too low for my wife to push me comfortably and we haven't found a way to adjust that yet. As for the seat itself, there are definitely more comfortable wheelchairs on the market. If you plan to use this primarily as a transport chair I think this is a great option for the price. However, if you're going to use it on a daily basis for hours at a time I suggest something much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: It’s not a bad chair but it does have some issues.
customer_reviews.text: It’s s pretty decent wheelchair for the price. It’s a little heavy for its small compact size and the rear tires are very hard and slick (very poor traction on asphalt, concrete and almost every surface I’ve used it on. I do like the arm-rests that raise up, parking brakes are great, and overall comfort is pretty good. I had double hip replacement due to AVN and was only confined to a wheelchair for about two- three months so this chair was fine for me. I would say that folks with more long-term or permanent conditions should probably get a much higher quality chair. Just my two cents worth
customer_reviews.author: Tim Haskins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for indoor use
customer_reviews.text: This wheelchair was used for only 2-3 weeks but was exactly what I needed to get around while in a non-weight bearing cast. It held up pretty well, but did need tightening after about the 2nd week as the wheels were a bit loose. Not terribly, but noticeable. This wheelchair be best used indoors as the wheels are smooth and would be difficult to gain any traction if on uneven or uphill ground. I would suggest getting a gel cushion for sitting as the seat is the typical "sling" type seat and could get very uncomfortable without padding of some kind.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieZ

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have been very impressed with this Drive Blue Streak wheelchair. The paint finish is flawless. The front wheel joint assembly is sealed from top to bottom. My 2 year old Invacare. SL 9000 chair was not and has already rusted a great deal as well as other parts also mentioning welds are breaking. The opening and closing of the Blue Streak is much smoother than the Invacare. Now lets talk cost. My insurance purchased my Invacare wheelchair at 10 times the cost of the Drive. I'm a big fella at 6' 2" at 215 lbs and this chair handles me just fine. I would recommend this chair to anyone looking for a durable nice looking wheelchair.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: We are very disappointed in this chair
customer_reviews.text: We are very disappointed in this chair. We bought it for my 14 year old 150 lb son after foot surgery. Tne arm pad came off on day 2. I reattached it only to have it come off again on a flight and be lost. After using it a couple of weeks, the left wheel separated from the bar holding it. I have attached a picture of the initial separation, but unfortunately it was totally broken and useless shortly thereafter. I didn't take a picture this time and just took the chair to the junkyard. To be 100 percent honest, we were using it on gravel and streets but I would have expected better from Drive.
customer_reviews.author: Tucker Sw

customer_reviews.title: The chair is good, and well-enough made for it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: The chair is good, and well-enough made for it's purpose. Mine had a manufacturing defect. The brakes were too close to the wheel, and the mounting holes in the wrong place to allow for adjustment. It can be fixed by drilling a new mounting hole in the frame about 1"-2" away from the wheel. See picture. Fixing it was easier than sending it back. This is a careless manufacturing defect in what is otherwise a good product for the $$.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken when received
customer_reviews.text: When we received this item one arm piece was broken. It has continuously gotten worst, and the chair is almost unusable now. I had not exchanged it because I did not have time to wait for another one. I will be looking for a better chair now.
customer_reviews.author: TheFamily

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Bought a used one. Came cracked with no footrests so I recommend only buying it new. It's a very good chair new. Like that arm rsets swing back for easy under the table. Even I can sorta lift the thing so able bodies it's super easy. Light. Easy to fold. Don't buy the cupholder. The screw is too long, extends through the nut, and is good for a poke in the leg. Plus if you lift the armrest you'll spill your drink.
customer_reviews.author: Cairy

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: The wheelchair is really a very functional one. I especially like the removable leg-rests. These made it easier for a handicapped person to get on and off the chair. The only gripe I have is with the handle-bars for the carer. As they cannot be folded, the wheelchair needs to be placed lying down even in a 7-seater and as a result, occupies a lot more space than necessary. Why not make foldable handle bars for the next model? That will make the wheelchair even better. It might be even better to add brakes for the carer pushing the wheelchair. Pushing the wheelchair downhill would be a lot safer.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Chong

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mother in law after she broke her femur. For the price I thought it’s going to be just ok to use for a few times until she can our weight on her leg but when we opened it from the box, we were impressed. It’s lightweight and easy to fold and it feels and look just like a real good wheelchair. Those kind that you borrow in malls or casino.
customer_reviews.author: Xutzen

customer_reviews.title: Not Height Adjustable
customer_reviews.text: The chair was just delivered about 15 minutes ago. It rolls alot nicer than the other Drive chair that my father-in-law had. My One real complaint so far is that the chair is not height adjustable at all. His other Drive chair was capable of being adjusted so his legs can fit under the dining room table. I bought him a gel cushion and with this new chair it's a tight fit for him. I will update my review after a couple days of use.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy S.

customer_reviews.title: Can't use the chair.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to use this wheelchair because it will not open. I have opened and closed wheelchairs many times but this one will not open. I have never given one star on a product before but this has me pissed off.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Im pleasantly surprised at the quality!
customer_reviews.text: Idk much about wheelchairs but i broke my leg and decided to buy this chair.. Figured it was worth a chance but was half expecting it to be low quality junk.. But im pleasantly surprised that its actually pretty good, and there was virtually no assembly required.. Nice! Its not perfect and some of the parts arent the best quality(like the the foot rests) ive been using tha chair for a week and one of the foot rests has already broken, since theyre made of plastic.. But I found aluminum replacements for about $35.(pair) I am very happy with this chair!
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Easy to Push / Use
customer_reviews.text: Bought after major foot surgery to get around. It was easy to open and adjust. Lightweight alternative to a full purpose well chair and at a much less cost. You can purchase a separate cup holder that attaches easily. Has a compartment to hold a blanket or other smaller item. Cheaper than buying at the drug store. Very comfortable and very easy to push.
customer_reviews.author: Alan M.

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up well
customer_reviews.text: This wheelchair does not seem to be holding up. My daughter is tall (5’7”) but only weighs about 115 pounds. The front wheels already have such extreme wobble that it has become difficult to steer herself on sidewalks at college. I will replace this unit with something more robust.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky a. f.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it within a couple of days. The larger set of wheels squeaked so badly, no one could stand to be in the same room with the occupant of the chair. Every little movement... squeak... squeak... squeak... It was like being in a fully loaded tightly packed car on a long drive with a styrofoam cooler in the back there, somewhere, squeaking, squeaking, squeaking. Lubing the wheels (or trying to) had no positive effect. All in all, it seemed like a nice chair, but sadly (and appropriately enough, considering its place of manufacture) sharing space with someone who uses the chair is Chinese water torture.
customer_reviews.author: Zero Ego

customer_reviews.title: Great for me!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I use the chair when I go out. No one has had any issues folding or lifting it and it fits in most any 4door car. Only thing I dont like, compared to my other cruise 3, is that the back doesnt velcro to the bottom of the seat at bottom so stuff falls out if I have it next to me. Nbd but I do like the velcro on the other one. Seat and back are lightly padded which is nice!
customer_reviews.author: D. Overbye

customer_reviews.title: I have been very disappointed with its functionality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this wheelchair to allow me to transport my 86 year old mother safely when I take her to doctor's visits. I have been very disappointed with its functionality. Mechanically speaking it was almost impossible to close once you opened it. Finally I had to lubricate the left arm shaft to allow it to move up and down freely. Since I have only had to use it once I am not sure how well it will function long term. You would think that the manufacturer would confirm that the chair works properly before shipping it. I am being kind to give it a 2-star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Bill R. Crutcher

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sturdy, plenty of room for average sized person.
customer_reviews.text: For light use, this wheelchair is great. I do notice that as I'm pushing it (I purchased it for my mother) that there is a little wiggling in the frame when going over bumps, but it doesn't necessarily feel unsteady. There is plenty of room for my mother (approx. 140lbs) as well as my three year old daughter. The ride is pretty smooth, and it doesn't feel like an olympic workout pushing it, even uphill. The fabric is easy to clean, and the little pouch on the back is a nice touch for keeping necessary supplies, such as kleenex, house keys, etc. Definitely worth investing in, the price wasn't exorbitantly high so it is a wise choice.
customer_reviews.author: Erica L. Bickel

customer_reviews.title: Good features for great price
customer_reviews.text: I broke my hip and needed to get around my house. It is a really good wheelchair for such a low price. It has some good features. I don't know how it will hold up over time but I wont need it in a few months I hope. It works best on hard floors or flat indoor carpet. I got some wheelchair gloves to get around on my carpeting.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer JennaW

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, carpeting is not your friend in this chair
customer_reviews.text: 80 yr can get around house that is NOT ADA compliant just fine with just a few decorating changes. Easily goes into trunk of Altima. Delivered well packaged, common sense assembly. Driver very professional and accommodating and brought box into house (the box itself was cumbersome, the chair is not).
customer_reviews.author: Grynne

customer_reviews.title: Wheelchair Exceeds Ezpextations
customer_reviews.text: The wheelchair i great but its advertised seat dimension is significantly different,. I will try to explain why. The distance between armrests is indeed 18 in. HOWEVER there is a bar ( circular ) on the inside, on both sides which makes the sitting area 18iinches minus 11/8 inches on each side or 153ches/4. Because of this I need a wider chair.20in ! --------------armrrest------------------------------! 18in. =====!! 000 000====== 000 000 !------= sitting area---! ! ====== 000!================= 000======
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Ganley

customer_reviews.title: Gave me mobility and freedom for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair! I broke my ankle and crutches were not my forte. This chair gave me mobility and freedom and was just the right size to fit into our doors and hallway. Definitely the answer for me. The only thing I wish it had was an extended foot/leg rest to keep my ankle elevated when I'm wheeling around...but I think there is a model that does offer that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Divine Choices

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Wheelchair works well for my wife. Weight is such that I can easily leverage it into the back of my SUV. Only slight wish is that there were better guides for replacing the footrests - have to fiddle with them to get them at just the right angle. Making the bottom pin taler than the top would help. Also, I had to replace the first arrival (Amazon was great about this). Due to a manufacturing defect, the hole for one of the wheel brakes had been drilled in the wrong place and was impossible to adjust. All is well with the replacement and we are happy wheelers!
customer_reviews.author: Stuphot

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chair.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 86 yo father. He uses a walker most of the time and really likes a the rolling office chair he has, but didn't like that he could not lock the wheels to keep it in place. This was great, especially with the arms that swing back out of the way - he likes to work on things at a table and this allows him to get up close. He did not need foot rests, so having the stationary removable ones was a good option for him.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: not usable
customer_reviews.text: The chair is not level. One side is a little higher than the other - one leg rest is higher than the other. The balance is completely off and I have to fight it to go in a straight path so that I don't hit a wall in the hallway here. I can not use it like this and the box was taken away by maintenance. I came home from long-term care to this thing. I am at a loss and do not know what to do. Unhappy!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair for a 3 month post surgery non weight bearing situation. I have used it my house, which is small, with ease. It is easy to maneuver, especially on hard surfaces. It folds and fits upright in a Honda Pilot and laid down in Nissan Juke. My only comment is, if you will be spending an extended period of time in the chair, a solid cushion for the seat might be a good investment, but that is true of any wheelchair. Totally a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Piece broke after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in October but did not start using regularly until May 2020. Liked that it is compact, light , easy to fold, goes through narrow doors in old house. After a few uses, the right arm rest did not snap into place and then a 1/4 inch piece of plastic (the catch) broke off. Called Drive but a limited warranty of 60 days had passed. Told there is not a replacement piece for this plastic and the whole right arm must be replaced which does not seem realistic or correct. Looked up the part and that is probably 1/2 the cost of the wheelchair. Plastic piece below blue metal bar had an edge that broke off. See pic:
customer_reviews.author: bob powers

customer_reviews.title: A REALLY GOOD BUY
customer_reviews.text: I didn't give 5 stars. It is because when folded and lifting to place in the trunk of your car, it is rather bulky and you have to be careful with the wheels turning. It would be great if it came with some kind of easy on easy off lock to prevent the wheels from turning which would make it much easier to lift & maneuver getting it in or out of the trunk. However, it is still a very good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: jbanjo

customer_reviews.title: First time spinning
customer_reviews.text: I like this chair. It is my first wheelchair so, I do t know that much about them. But, it seems to work well and isn’t overly heavy. Sometimes it is difficult to open though. It’s a bit smaller than I expected. So I would buy one size up if you want to have a arm rest organizer. It is pretty easy to use though. I do get shocked a lot though... haven’t quite figured out how to touch metal shelves without getting zapped into another time!
customer_reviews.author: Abbe Norma

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a close friend & he luvs it. His old wheelchair didn't have working brakes which was causing a big problem for him getting up and down into the chair. This new chair works great, rolls smoothly, fits through the 32" doors in his home & the foot rests really help when he needs to go to doctor visits. The pricing was great and the unit is wonderful. I highly recommend this chair if you are in need of 1.
customer_reviews.author: elmo blackie

customer_reviews.title: Right for some but light duty
customer_reviews.text: This is strictly a light weight wheel chair. It is smaller which suits smaller people who are not going to be in the chair all day and night. It doesn't appear flimsy. So, if either the pusher or the pushed or both are not big, heavy people and their wheel chair need are modest, it's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Un lector exigente

customer_reviews.title: Great wheelchair for the price
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely can't beat this chair for the price. I am 5'5" 180 pounds with a horrible back. I use crutches for short distances but needed something for longer treks like the mall and Walmart. This is sooo perfect. Rides very smooth and the moveable arms make sitting under a table easy. My kids (11 and 12 years old) maneuver it easily over multiple terranes with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Vega

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price but too much flex...
customer_reviews.text: Used in NYC with lots of obstructions and curbs to maneuver through and around. Use mode was with me pushing an adult using the handles from the rear. Too much flex in the frame. Meaning the unit flexes at the joints and connections of the frame before the force you apply to change direction takes effect and you actually change direction. It works and I continue to use it, but I now know to buy a sturdier product that does not flex as much before the force applied turns into motion and or changing of direction.
customer_reviews.author: wuxia fan

customer_reviews.title: A Good, Inexpensive Wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter who has been having back problems. It arrived well packaged, assembled, and ready to use. It was a little stiff to spread the wheels, but that has subsided. It seems well made. Although at 42 lb it's a bit heavy lifting in and out of the back of the car, but manageable. A good choice if you are in need of a wheelchair.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected
customer_reviews.text: This wheelchair was a great deal for the price. I Purchased it because I was temporarily immobile. Because of the low price I wasn’t really expecting great value, but boy was I pleasantly surprised! This wheelchair is very sturdy and will last a long time. It arrives mostly assembled the only things that have to be put on are the leg rests.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Stewart

customer_reviews.title: It fits through smaller doorways
customer_reviews.text: Great chair for the price. It will be used mostly indoors and I think it will be good. The wheels themselves seem a little flimsy, and flex a bit when you put the brakes on. My dad is 5'7 and around 185lbs. We went with the 20" seat. He's used it for a couple days and has not asked for a seat cushion. It is 24" wide outside of the wheels. Pouch on back of seat is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Baer

customer_reviews.title: Made my injury managable
customer_reviews.text: After breaking my leg,I was sent home with crutches. What a nightmare. So, that evening I ordered this wheelchair. It arrived the next morning! I'm so glad I did! It was light enough for me to pull out of the box without help.and unfolded into my chariot. I am able to roll around the house with ease, as well as pop it in the car to get shopping ect. Great chair at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: Husband had to do the lifting me, pushing me, and dealing with the mechanics of the chair; but we were both very pleased with this purchase in every aspect. It is comfortable, and quite easy to maneuver. I did not use this in home so I don't know how it would do in small spaces. It's an excellent chair for us.
customer_reviews.author: AnAmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable , easy to fold.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a backup for my husband's primary wheelchair. After a few uses, he decided to use this as the primary wheelchair. I t is fairly easy to fold and it is a bit heavier than our other chair, but still lighter than his old chair. It is very maneuverable.
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: Not good for someone heavy
customer_reviews.text: If you are overweight or big hips, don’t use this chair. It’s too narrow on the hips and squeezes you uncomfortably. I bought this for my mom who weighs 220 ibs, and she 5.1 feet. They should’ve constructed this wider. Not happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fold,not so easy to un fold.Weighs a lot more then I expected,I’m positive I couldn’t lift it into a cars trunk,it’s fine for around the house or wherever it’s needed,but unless your in very good physical condition it’s not going to travel well.A great buy at $100.just not portable for some people.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Berry

customer_reviews.title: For $100 it awesome
customer_reviews.text: What only $99 . Awesome deal . Doctor wrote an a prescription for s pediatric chair for my sons Broken leg but this was so cheap and easy . It did arrive late and the wheels don’t look so great but for $100 it perfect for a Broken leg and not having to deal with medical supply company .
customer_reviews.author: spent more time looking and closing out 4 levels of marketing before. games ...please don't make kids watch it

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart easily and material on arm rest coming off.
customer_reviews.text: This wheel chair was purchased a couple of months ago. Since then several pieces have came off of it. Its durable as it supports my weight (166 currently). Had survived a fall from truck on hwy. after reading reviews unlikely to get replaced parts that had come off.
customer_reviews.author: Diehardlinux

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: I first wrote that i can't imagine a better deal than this. Shows quality in every part. Easy to set up. BUT,where are the footrests? The unit came without them. I later found them in the bottom of the shipping container. Sorry Drive
customer_reviews.author: RBuck

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This product was promised shipped as a prime item. To my disappointment it came a week after the suggest “prime” ship date. Not only did it come late but it also came broken. The right arm of the wheelchair doesn’t even fit into place. I am extremely disappointed as this was a necessity for my sick grandfather who obviously can not walk and it was bought for our family to easily bring him to his doctors appointments. I highly suggest you do not buy this wheelchair and furthermore defiantly not through amazon. I will be reaching out to amazon directly as well. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Well deserving of more stars
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived in a large box and preassembled. I literally just had to remove packing material and open the wheelchair and it was ready for use. For us, this was an excellent purchase and we would highly recommend this for anyone needing a wheelchair. The price was great, shipping was good (despite the 3 day delay) and we couldn't be happier. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Mum so she can continue her adventures in style. Arrived in a box that was trashed-I was concerned the wheelchair was damaged but alas, it was in perfect shape. Love this chair-it has a padded seat, very comfortable. The pocket in the pack is useful- I store the tool used to keep nuts and bolts tightened. The chair folds easily and is easy enough to lift in and out of a trunk. Money was well spent as this will enable Mum to spend more time out and about without walking too much.
customer_reviews.author: mom of four

customer_reviews.title: This chair is so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this wheelchair. I never used one until i broke .y ankle the day after Christmas. My husband ordered this chair, it has been wonderful. I go to church, doctor's appointments out to breakfast. It folds up to go anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Stelle

customer_reviews.title: Wheeling chair style
customer_reviews.text: The bolts on the back wheels would grab each other and make it hard to open at times. Maybe a cap on them would help. It was hard to man over on anything but smooth ground. If you pull it backwards it worked better. It didn’t feel too sturdy but it never broke or fell apart
customer_reviews.author: CLFish1

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Cheerful!
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap Wheelchair, That is a good thing. The quality is pretty good for price. I'd say this is perfect for a wheelchair that is going to get occasional use or temporary use. Perfect for someone who is getting older and needs a chair to make life easier. I have a father-in-law that is getting on a bit. He can walk but if we want to take him out and about with the family he gets tired very easily. He can still get up and walk about but if he needs a rest we can wheel him about. It folds up pretty flat too.
customer_reviews.author: Zoot

customer_reviews.title: Stiff Wheels
customer_reviews.text: The wheels are so stiff that my Mother can barely get around in it. I've tried to loosen them, as well as try to add oil to it. Having to get her a new one.
customer_reviews.author: LRG

customer_reviews.title: Broken after three months
customer_reviews.text: The footrest is plastic and one has already broken and drags on the ground. Manufacturer advises that the 60 day warranted is up so I will have to purchase needed parts. I will be shopping for another brand instead.
customer_reviews.author: modestcritic

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: Got this chair for my Mom's 85th Birthday. She loves the color and feels very "zippy" in it. It is the perfect fit for her - easy to get in and out of doorways, bathrooms, etc. Even if they are not ADA. The flip up arms make transferring easy. And it fits in the trunk of my small car much better than her old one! We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Southern Comfort

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price, excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a lightweight but sturdy wheelchair for my Mom when she came to visit and had recently become "walking challenged". I live in a resort town and we didn't want Mom to be house-bound and to still enjoy the boardwalk and beach environment, as well as shopping, etc. This wheelchair is so easy to use and so lightweight, yet sturdy and very comfortable! The price was exactly where I needed it to be!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Sommers

customer_reviews.title: WHY PAY MORE?
customer_reviews.text: This basic wheelchair is all you need, even if you use it a lot. Extremely easy to maneuver, pretty easy to fold up, and very lightweight. You MIGHT want more if you live in the chair all day, but for periodic use, this chair is GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Brown

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: My 96 year old dad has a difficult time locking the wheels. Also the release for the chair arms to remove them is easily depressed when the user has to hold onto the lower chair arms to lift themselves. Otherwise is a great chair for him and for me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Box was open at both ends when it was delivered
customer_reviews.text: I'm assuming anything like a manual or instructions fell out of the box during shipping since there is nothing to be found on how to assemble or operate it. Not cool. Once we figure out how it goes together, I may or may not change the rating.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for trip for easier mobility for an older relative. Maneuvers well and folds easily. Seems to be sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: TNT SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Light weight easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: We bought this wheelchair for my mom very easy to manage also durable would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Best value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: One of my best purchases for the money! It’s bright blue, sturdy, easy to fold up, and I can still get it some tight spaces in my house, like hallways, bathrooms and bedrooms. And it’s lightweight. You can take off the foot rests. Easy peasy. Love my Blue Streak!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Fingal

customer_reviews.title: OK for minimal use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, lightweight. I like that the foot rest is easy to put on it take off. I like it's easy to fold (not so easy to open though). I don't like it doesn't come with a belt/strap. Wheels are not the best quality and if you run/walk quickly they tend to wobble. Fairly good for minimal use and price though
customer_reviews.author: s t

customer_reviews.title: Quality Built
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice chair for the money. I just use it every now and then to move my father when he comes to the house. With my research, If you need a lighter weight chair, you will have to expect to pay more, but this one is well built and easily maneuverable.
customer_reviews.author: Scanty22

customer_reviews.title: Grandma’s future ride
customer_reviews.text: The box was in pieces when I received my chair had straps to hold the cardboard on the chair. After having the chair for one evening I really used it for Maneuvering around the house. Much easier than crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela E Stein

customer_reviews.title: Love this wheelchair, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love this wheelchair, especially for the price. Easy to push. Well made. So much nicer to have your own wheelchair, even when going to the doctor's office. Don't have to hunt down a wheelchair when we get there. Not too bad getting it into and out of the back of my SUV. It's not light, but not as heavy as the ones in the hospital. Again you can't beat the price. Walmart was $25 more.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal!
customer_reviews.text: After renting what I considered to be a high quality wheelchair for $40 a week, I was a little nervous about buying one at $100. This wheelchair surpasses all my expectations, durable and same size as the one I was renting. Love the fact that the arms are adjustable as well as I can now get up close to tables at restaurants. Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Callie

customer_reviews.title: Warranty is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in May of 2019. Always sticky in folding and unfolding. Over time it got to the point where the slides needed to collapse it were completely Jammed. After going around and around with online support (no consumer phone number) turns out the only thing their 3 year warranty covers is welds. EVERYTHING else is 60 days. What a joke - after complaining they finally agreed to send me one part (I hope it is the correct part to fix the jamming) but I have to completely disassemble and reassemble the chair myself
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P.

customer_reviews.title: missing parts and more!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this wheelchair and then had to reorder as leg attachments missing BOTH times and the box was in terrible condition following shipping; it was ripped and partially opened. The actual chair is lightweight and seems like it will be a good fit if we can get the leg pieces. Please advise how to proceed???
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: It is narrow enough to fit through the doorways in older homes.
customer_reviews.text: I gave only three stars because one arm would not stay secure no matter how you tightened the screw. Also the synthetic leather split from the seam on the front of the arm rest. I have had the product for 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: TripleL

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for when I have tours in my community and the potential resident or family might get too tired doing the whole tour of our community! Great price, great chair-light weight but they all say very comfortable ride!
customer_reviews.author: mandyleah3

customer_reviews.title: I need a real light weight chair up to 25 pounds, not 40 plus pounds.
customer_reviews.text: Can't get the brakes to work, weighs more than website says. This chair is not lite weight. Too heavy for my Home health care Aides to lift so I can use it outside the home.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Hall

customer_reviews.title: Light, good material, easy to fold and maneuver.
customer_reviews.text: I am 37 years old 5 7' tall and 190 lb I broke my right foot, the result of that was an awful and super painful three bones fracture and to fix it, I had surgery. so my husband ordered this wheelchair for easy transportation to the hospital, doctor visits and for me to move around the house. I like it that is light and easy to maneuver and good material.
customer_reviews.author: Korina peters

customer_reviews.title: I think this wheelchair is good because . . .
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wheelchair because it had good reviews and it was priced reasonably. I bought it but sent it directly to someone else. They appreciated getting it and said it worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No foot rests
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice new "ride" for my mom, HOWEVER. where are the foot rests?
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Hughes

customer_reviews.title: This chair is so much better than I expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: This chair is so much better than I expected for the price. After using an OLD wheelchair, this one is so much more comfortable and is made well. I broke my foot in an unusual spot and cannot put any pressure on it for six weeks. This chair has been a life saver. And the cost was a real plus!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janice Wark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wheelchair, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wheelchair, especially for the price. Well constructed, comfortable, and smooth operation. It folds fine, but at times needs a bit of persuasion. Foot supports easily removable, if desired. Used daily for a week, and no complaints. All in all, a very nice product.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper422

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: My wheelchair came today and I love it. I really like the way the arms fold back out of the way. I'm short, just 5'1" tall. The arms on most wheelchairs rub against my underarms and cause a rash. Now no more rashes. Thank you, Thank you, Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Tookeelou

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a great compact chair. I purchased this chair for my dad after he lost his leg in a work accident. He has a small frame and he loves this chair. This chair has helped him remain mobile and gives him the ability to complete many daily tasks on his own while he waits for his leg to heal enough for a prosthetic.
customer_reviews.author: Tesia Badgero

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed it for
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I needed it for. I have CPOD and get short of breath when I have to walk very far. This is reasonable priced, light weight and folds easily. I wouldn't recommend for a person who is in a wheelchair full time, but for occasional use for some one who needs a ride to join an outing, this is great.
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: The wheel chair was in good shape by some miracle and the box was trashed ...
customer_reviews.text: The wheel chair was in good shape by some miracle and the box was trashed mashed and big hole on one side. I almost did not order this charir because of complaints about this same issue. I decided to give it a chance and was disapponted to see a torn up box. With a great product why would you keep sending them out in such an inferior box.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lax

customer_reviews.title: Drive Medical Wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: Comes in handy when we have our aging parents come over.
customer_reviews.author: I Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Handy, lightweight and durable wheelchair.
customer_reviews.text: This portable wheelchair has been a blessing for my mom, who's 92 yrs. old, to get her to her doctor appointments, shopping, etc. Folds up easily, to fit in your car trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Quintis Arrius

product_meta.title: Drive Medical Blue Streak Wheelchair with Flip Back Desk Arms, Swing Away Footrests, 18 Inch Seat
product_meta.description: Style:Swing Away Footrests| Size:18 InchDrive Medical's Blue Streak Wheelchair features cutting-edge design with premium swing-away leg rests and detachable desk arms that flip back for advanced versatility and simple transportation. The 18" padded seat is ergonomically crafted for comfort to make independent mobility easy and enjoyable. The tires, made of solid rubber and mounted on composite wheels, ensure a consistently smooth ride, and feature push-to-lock functionality for extra safety. The sleek blue-powdered frame is finished with durable steel to resist cracks and chipping. The black cross brace and nylon seat upholstery are sturdy, lightweight and low-maintenance to clean.
feature_bullets: Cutting-edge wheelchair design makes independent mobility enjoyable. Width open with 20 inch seat is 26 inch
Detachable desk arms and premium swing-away leg rests provide customizable support. Seat-To-floor Height- 19.5 inches
18" padded nylon wheelchair seat ensures lasting comfort and is easy to clean
Durable tires feature push-to-lock functionality for safety. Comes with calf strap
Overall Dimensions: 42"(L) x 24"(W) x 36"(H); Closed Width: 12.5"; Seat Dimensions: 16"(D) x 18"(W) x 19.5"(H); Armrest Height: 8"; Weight Capacity: 250 lbs
Dimensions of the seat is 16x19x18 inches and the seat height is 18 inches

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
